results.title: The Pacific century
results.creator_credit: Al Levin, Marc Levin, Teleac Holland, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Pacific century”.
The final program in the series looks at America’s future as a “Pacific nation” by charting current economic and political trends, including the flood of Asian investment in the U.S., the domination of Asian technology and the rapid growth of Asian immigration. Through portraits of politicians, business leaders and working men and women “The Pacific century” will confront the economic, political and cultural challenges that will determine America’s future in this region to which it is inextricably connected.

results.title: The Pacific century
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Teleac Holland, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description: A series which describes and explains the emergence, from the nineteenth century onward, of modern nations from the rich and varied cultures and societies of Pacific Asia. A Study Guide and Faculty Manual are also available to accompany this telecourse.

results.title: The Pace that thrills
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Frank Gardner
results.brief_description: A short review of some of Britain’s leading track athletes in action. Gordon Pirie, Mary Bignall Rand and Peter Radford demonstrate the correct methods of starting, sprinting, long-distance running and hurdling.

results.title: The Pace that kills
results.brief_description: Excessive speed is the number one killer on the roads: one-thrid of all road deaths are caused by it. By excessive speeding drivers risk their own lives and those of others.

results.title: The Oxyacetylene flame: master of metals
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of the oxyacetylene welding torch and illustrates the tuypes of work it will perfomr. Shows how acetylene is produced from carbide manufactured from limestone and coke and how this gas is burnt with oxygen manufactured from the air. The regulation of gases in the torch is explained and welding, brazing and cutting techniques are demonstrated. Contains animated segments to illustrate use of equipment.
results.description: Explains the principles of the oxyacetylene welding torch and illustrates the tuypes of work it will perfomr. Shows how acetylene is produced from carbide manufactured from limestone and coke and how this gas is burnt with oxygen manufactured from the air. results.title: The Owl who married a goose: an Eskimo legend
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, ONF | NFB and Caroline Leaf
results.brief_description: An Eskimo legend of a goose that captures the fancy of an owl. Although the voices are in Inuktitut Caroline Leaf’s innovative animation leave no doubt as to the happenings that transpire. It is a story with wry humour characteristic of many Inuit tales, for audiences young and old. Editing, Pierre Lemelin. (Eight awards, including Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)

results.title: The Owl and the raven: an Eskimo legend
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, ONF | NFB and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: According to this Inuit legend the raven was not always the jet-black bird that it is today. The owl had something to do with it. What happened makes an engaging story acted out by two life-like puppets made of seal fur. The film, narrated partly in Inuktitut, partly in English, is largely the work of Inuit artists. Voice and narration by Toojatogak Itoacheak and Elatak Nakashook.

results.title: The Owl and the pussycat
results.creator_credit: Ray Stark, Rastar Productions, Herbert Ross and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Felix (Segal) and Doris (Streisand) are two mismatched neighbours. Felix is a writer, and Doris a prostitute and performer in the 42nd street flick, “Cycle sluts”. They share the same apartment building and annoyance at each other; such as his incessant typing and her numerous male callers. Despite these difference the two become firm friends, facilitating some pretty amusing dialogue between the clash of cultures and morals. The soundtrack is performed by Blood Sweat and Tears. Alan Alda and Diane Sands played the two title characters in the Broadway production, which is based on the play “The Owl and the pussycat” by Robert Klein.

results.title: The Owl and the pussycat
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A film of Barbara Cooney’s illustrations to Edward Lear’s poem. The owl and the pussycat travel in a pea-green boat to the land of Bong-tree where they are married by the turkey who lives on the hill. Photographed by Alexander Cochran. Suitable for primary school level.
